meanings.definition: To adjust the timing of something to synchronize with something else.
meanings.sent1: She was phasing her steps to match the beat of the music.
meanings.sent2: The dancers were phasing their movements perfectly with the music.
meanings.sent3: The chef was phasing the cooking time of each dish like a skilled conductor.
meanings.sent4: The team phasing their efforts together like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The synchronized swimmers were phasing their routines flawlessly.

meanings.definition: The act of gradually changing or transitioning.
meanings.sent1: The phasing of the seasons from summer to fall was beautiful.
meanings.sent2: The phasing of colors in the sunset was breathtaking.
meanings.sent3: The phasing of the caterpillar into a butterfly was truly magical.
meanings.sent4: The phasing of the moon through its different stages fascinated the children.
meanings.sent5: The phasing of emotions during the play moved the audience deeply.

meanings.sent1: The phasing of the project was completed ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent2: The phasing of the storm brought heavy rain for a short time.
meanings.sent3: The phasing of the power outage caused a brief moment of panic.
meanings.sent4: The phasing of the traffic jam cleared up quickly.
meanings.sent5: The phasing of the meeting allowed for a short break.
